00028 class ImageFormat_TarProxy: public FileFormat
00029 {
00030 private:
00031     struct {
00032         char name[100];
00033         char mode[8];
00034         char uid[8];
00035         char gid[8];
00036         char size[12];
00037         char mtime[12];
00038         char chksum[8];
00039         char typeflag;
00040         char linkname[100];
00041         char magic[6];
00042         char version[2];
00043         char uname[32];
00044         char gname[32];
00045         char devmajor[8];
00046         char devminor[8];
00047         char prefix[155];
00048         char padding[12];
00049     } tar_header;
00050     bool read_header( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, size_t &size, size_t &next_header_in ) {
00051         if( boost::iostreams::read( src, reinterpret_cast<char *>( &tar_header ), 512 ) == 512 ) {
00052             //get the size
00053             std::stringstream buff( tar_header.size );
00054             size = 0, next_header_in = 0;
00055 
00056             if( tar_header.size[10] != 0 ) {
00057                 buff >> std::oct >> size;
00058                 next_header_in = ( size / 512 ) * 512 + ( size % 512 ? 512 : 0 );
00059             }
00060 
00061             return true;
00062         } else
00063             return false;
00064     }
00065     static size_t tar_readstream( const boost::iostreams::filtering_istream &src, void *dst, size_t size, const std::string &log_title ) {
00066         size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( src, ( char * )dst, size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00067 
00068         if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00069             LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << util::MSubject( log_title );
00070         }
00071 
00072         return red;
00073     }
00074 
00075 protected:
00076     std::string suffixes()const {
00077         return std::string( "tar tar.gz tgz tar.bz2 tbz tar.Z taz" );
00078     }
00079 public:
00080     std::string dialects( const std::string &/*filename*/ )const {
00081 
00082         std::list<util::istring> suffixes;
00083         BOOST_FOREACH( data::IOFactory::FileFormatPtr format, data::IOFactory::getFormats() ) {
00084             const std::list<util::istring> s = format->getSuffixes();
00085             suffixes.insert( suffixes.end(), s.begin(), s.end() );
00086         }
00087         suffixes.sort();
00088         suffixes.unique();
00089 
00090         return std::string( util::listToString( suffixes.begin(), suffixes.end(), " ", "", "" ) );
00091     }
00092     std::string getName()const {return "tar decompression proxy for other formats";}
00093 
00094     int load ( std::list<data::Chunk> &chunks, const std::string &filename, const std::string &dialect ) throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00095         int ret = 0;
00096 
00097         const util::istring suffix = makeBasename( filename ).second.c_str();
00098 
00099 
00100         // set up the input stream
00101         std::ifstream input( filename.c_str(), std::ios_base::binary );
00102         input.exceptions( std::ios::badbit );
00103         boost::iostreams::filtering_istream in;
00104 
00105         if( suffix == ".tar.gz" || suffix == ".tgz" )
00106             in.push( boost::iostreams::gzip_decompressor() );
00107         else if( suffix == ".tar.bz2" || suffix == ".tbz" )
00108             in.push( boost::iostreams::bzip2_decompressor() );
00109         else if( suffix == ".tar.Z" || suffix == ".taz" )
00110             in.push( boost::iostreams::zlib_decompressor() );
00111 
00112         in.push( input );
00113 
00114         size_t size, next_header_in;
00115 
00116         while( in.good() && read_header( in, size, next_header_in ) ) { //read the header block
00117 
00118             boost::filesystem::path org_file;
00119 
00120             if( tar_header.typeflag == 'L' ) { // the filename of the next file is to long - so its stored in the next block (following this header)
00121                 char namebuff[size];
00122                 next_header_in -= tar_readstream( in, namebuff, size, "overlong filename for next entry" );
00123                 in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00124                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( namebuff );
00125                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Got overlong name " << util::MSubject( org_file.file_string() ) << " for next file.";
00126 
00127                 read_header( in, size, next_header_in ); //continue with the next header
00128             } else {
00129                 //get the original filename (use substr, because these fields are not \0-terminated)
00130                 org_file = boost::filesystem::path( std::string( tar_header.prefix ).substr( 0, 155 ) + std::string( tar_header.name ).substr( 0, 100 ) );
00131             }
00132 
00133             if( size == 0 ) //if there is no content skip this entry (there are allways two "empty" blocks at the end of a tar)
00134                 continue;
00135 
00136             if( tar_header.typeflag == AREGTYPE || tar_header.typeflag == REGTYPE ) {
00137 
00138                 data::IOFactory::FileFormatList formats = data::IOFactory::getFileFormatList( org_file.file_string(), dialect ); // and get the reading pluging for that
00139 
00140                 if( formats.empty() ) {
00141                     LOG( Runtime, notice ) << "Skipping " << org_file << " from " << filename << " because no plugin was found to read it"; // skip if we found none
00142                 } else {
00143                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Got " << org_file << " from " << filename << " there are " << formats.size() << " plugins which should be able to read it";
00144 
00145                     const std::pair<std::string, std::string> base = formats.front()->makeBasename( org_file.file_string() );//ask any of the plugins for the suffix
00146                     util::TmpFile tmpfile( "", base.second );//create a temporary file with this suffix
00147 
00148                     data::FilePtr mfile( tmpfile, size, true );
00149 
00150                     if( !mfile.good() ) {
00151                         throwSystemError( errno, std::string( "Failed to open temporary " ) + tmpfile.file_string() );
00152                     }
00153 
00154                     LOG( Debug, info ) << "Mapped " << size << " bytes of " << mfile.getLength() << " at " << ( void * )&mfile[0];
00155 
00156                     size_t red = boost::iostreams::read( in, ( char * )&mfile[0], size ); // read data from the stream into the mapped memory
00157                     next_header_in -= red;
00158                     mfile.close(); //close and unmap the temporary file/mapped memory
00159 
00160                     if( red != size ) { // read the data from the stream
00161                         LOG( Runtime, warning ) << "Could not read all " << size << " bytes for " << tmpfile.file_string();
00162                     }
00163 
00164                     // read the temporary file
00165                     std::list<data::Chunk>::iterator prev = chunks.end();
00166                     --prev;
00167                     ret += data::IOFactory::load( chunks, tmpfile.string(), dialect );
00168 
00169                     for( ; prev != chunks.end(); ++prev ) { // set the source property of the red chunks to something more usefull
00170                         prev->setPropertyAs( "source", ( boost::filesystem::path( filename ) / org_file ).file_string() );
00171                     }
00172                 }
00173             } else {
00174                 LOG( Debug, verbose_info ) << "Skipping " << org_file.file_string() << " because its no regular file (type is " << tar_header.typeflag << ")" ;
00175             }
00176 
00177             in.ignore( next_header_in ); // skip the remaining input until the next header
00178         }
00179 
00180         return ret;
00181     }
00182 
00183     void write( const data::Image &/*image*/, const std::string &/*filename*/, const std::string &/*dialect*/ )throw( std::runtime_error & ) {
00184         throw( std::runtime_error( "Writing to tar is not (yet) implemented" ) );
00185     }
00186     bool tainted()const {return false;}//internal plugins are not tainted
00187 };
00188 }
00189 }
00190 isis::image_io::FileFormat *factory()
00191 {
00192     return new isis::image_io::ImageFormat_TarProxy();
